title: Nipsey Hussle's partner Lauren London awarded guardianship over son and control of his inheritance
text:
The death of Nipsey Hussle was felt by many when he was killed back in March.

But none were so affected as his family, including partner Lauren London, with whom he shared son Kross.

London was recently granted guardianship over their son, putting her in control of the half of Hussle's estate Kross is set to inherit, according to TMZ.

Guardianship granted: Lauren London was recently granted guardianship over her and Nipsey Hussle's son Kross, putting her in control of his inheritance

The three-year-old is expected to inherit $1 million, which his mother will be in charge of handling.

London, 34, has never appeared to have issues with the rapper's family in regards to raising Kross.

However, his ex Tanisha Foster, with whom he shared daughter Emani, battled Hussle's brother Samiel Asghedom and sister Samantha for custody of the 10-year-old.

Samiel is currently the manager of the late community activist's estate, which is expected to be worth $2 million.

Late partner: London and Hussle, who was born Ermias Asghedom, began dating in 2013, giving birth to Kross in 2016

Happy family: London, 34, has never appeared to have issues with the rapper's family in regards to raising Kross

Custody battle: However, his ex Tanisha Foster, with whom he shared daughter Emani, battled Hussle's brother Samiel Asghedom and sister Samantha for custody of the 10-year-old

According to TMZ, this situation differs from a usual estate, which is created when someone dies.

London and Hussle, who was born Ermias Asghedom, began dating in 2013, giving birth to Kross in 2016.

She and Kross took to the stage at the BET Awards in June with his family to accept the Humanitarian Award on his behalf.

The noteworthy entrepreneur died at 33 years old back in March, when he was shot in front of his South Los Angeles store Marathon Clothing.

His alleged killer Eric Holder is currently awaiting trial, as he was charged with murder, two counts of attempted murder and one count of possession of a firearm.
